sanskrit_verse:
जातिमात्रोपजीवी वा कामं स्याद्ब्राह्मणब्रुवः ।
धर्मप्रवक्ता नृपतेर्न शूद्रः कथंचन ॥ ८.२०॥
transliteration: jātimātropana jīvī vā kāmaṃ syādbrāhmaṇabruvaḥ | dharmapravaktā nṛpater na śūdraḥ kathañcana || 8.20 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who merely lives by birth-based entitlement or desires to be called a Brāhmaṇa shall not become a speaker of Dharma for the king under any circumstance.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from realization, not lineage
Causation arises from inner integrity, not social role
Restoration logic demands alignment with Śiva-dharma
executable_legal_axioms: IF claimant asserts title without embodiment THEN disqualify from dharma-advisory roles
IF individual identifies as brāhmaṇa solely through birth THEN exclude from judicial counsel
IF advisor lacks self-realization THEN invalidate advisory status in state matters
IF person acts from desire alone THEN deny authority in dharmic governance contexts
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, eligibility for providing dharmic counsel or testimony must be assessed based on experiential capacity rather than hereditary position. Birth-based claims without corresponding consciousness realization are legally insufficient for authoritative input.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that true authority manifests only through lived realization. As sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ) proceeds from consciousness to action, responsibility aligns accordingly. Proportional accountability arises from the degree of embodied truth, not inherited designation. The non-punitive reality rule affirms correction through re-alignment, not penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process: guide false claimant toward actual spiritual practice
Implement responsibility assumption protocol: redirect individual into rightful svadharma path
Restore capacity through śaktipāt initiation if qualified
Reintegrate integrity via association with realized beings
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: authority flows from Śiva-consciousness alone; all else is pretense awaiting correction. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness reigns as sole adjudicator.
